title: Beaker, 1680
markings:
4/A in shield,
also cipher or monogram possibly CVD
identification obliterated and re-worked
provenance: Given by the Estate of Harry G. Friedman
description: Tall, trumpet-shaped cup with incised flowers and fruits between c-scrolls surrounding three cartouches, each containing a woman symbolizing Faith, Hope and Charity respectively; "crown of thorn" band encircles the beaker where footed section decorated with strapwork and winged cherub joins cup.
